[SYNTAX]: Awkward phrasing in poetic section (e.g., "the dint of hoof, the print of booted heel")
[LEXICON]: Archaic or overly formal language in some passages (e.g., "happily hunting-grounds", "stuff trees")
[SPELLING]: Repeated use of "[thing]" suggests missing or redacted text, disrupting flow

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt transition from poetic to historical narrative without clear connection
[CLARITY]: Overuse of "[thing]" for unspecified nouns causes confusion
[LOGIC]: Historical events jump abruptly in time without clear chronological markers

[LEXICON]: Overuse of vague terms ("a thing", "stuff") for specific entities
[SYNTAX]: Complex sentence structures may impede smooth reading in some passages

[CLARITY]: Unclear references to unspecified entities ("a stuff", "a thing") throughout
[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt transition between historical events and the introduction of new characters (e.g., from Ybarbo to Nolan)
[LOGIC]: Assumed prior knowledge of historical context (e.g., Wilkinson and Burr's schemes) without brief explanation
